solution.text:
Given quadratic equation is : \(_{j}_x^2 - _{{(k*j)+l}}_x + _{{l*k}}_ = 0\)
Let us first split the middle term -_{{(k*j)+l}}_x as -_{{k*j}}_x and -_{l}_x
[because \((-_{{k*j}}_x) \times (-_{l}_x) = _{{k*l*j}}_x^2 = _{j}_x^2\times _{{k*l}}_\)]
So,
\(_{j}_x^2 - _{{(k*j)+l}}_x + _{{l*k}}_ = 0\)
\(_{j}_x^2 - _{{j*k}}_x - _{l}_x + _{{l*k}}_ = 0\)
\(_{j}_x(x - _{k}_)- _{l}_(x - _{k}_) = 0\)
\((x-_{k}_)(_{j}_x-_{l}_) = 0\)
Now,
\(_{j}_x^2 - _{{(k*j)+l}}_x + _{{l*k}}_ = 0\) can be written as (x - _{k}_)(_{j}_x-_{l}_) = 0.
So, the value of x for which (x-_{k}_)(_{j}_x-_{l}_) = 0,
i.e., either x - _{k}_ = 0 or _{j}_x - _{l}_ = 0.
Now,
x - _{k}_ = 0 gives x = _{k}_ and _{j}_x - _{l}_ = 0 gives x = \(_{l}_\over _{j}_\)
So, x = _{k}_ and x = _{{trunc(Decimal(l)/j,2)}}_ are the roots of given quadratic equation.

content.text: Find the roots of the equation \(_{j}_x^2 - _{{(j*k)+l}}_x + _{{l*k}}_ = 0\), by factorisation.
